title: What is the difference between Devanagari and Grantha script? - Quora

response.answer_text: Devanagari otherwise known as nagari.it is written from left to right.It has roots in the ancient brahmi script Family.it has 47 primary characters ,of which 14 are vowels&33 are consonants. The grantha alphabet is an indian script ;which widely used between the 6th&20thC by tamil and malayalam speakers in south Ferro battuto - India.it | cancelli, paletti, ringhiere, griglie, corrimano e parapetti. is a brahmanic script.
